poem:
**The Transatlantic Screen**

City corridors echo  
like synthpop shadows,  
Sir Henry's gaze  
pierces tabloids,  
amid the hum  
of American notes.  
  
In the strip club glare,  
British whispers merge –  
a dance of mirrored currency.  
Industry weaves under  
an omnishambolic sun,  
where stars and stripes  
intrude, silently enthroned.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘The vibe may be British, but the money is not’: how the US quietly conquered UK TV My favourite TV show of 2024 couldn’t be any more British if it tried. Set in a City investment bank violently buffeted by an omnishambolic treasury, soundtracked by wry, maudlin 1980s UK synthpop (Simple Minds, Pet Shop Boys) and featuring a character named Sir Henry Muck, Industry scans British society, from strip clubs and tabloids to private members’". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
